channel.title: BBC News - Northern Ireland

item.title: Covid-19: GAA stadium gets mobile vaccine pop-up
item.description: Anyone aged 18 or over can get a first Pfizer dose at Saturday's pop-up clinic.

item.title: Pastor James McConnell dies aged 84 after long illness
item.description: The Belfast preacher's death is announced by Whitewell Tabernacle, the church which he founded.

item.title: Egyptian vulture spotted in Ireland for the first time
item.description: The endangered Egyptian vulture paid a flying visit to the village of Dunfanaghy in County Donegal.

item.title: Covid-19: Southern Trust suspends hospital visits as cases spike
item.description: The decision was taken as NI recorded its highest daily number of coronavirus cases since January.

item.title: Badger cull considered in attempt to tackle bovine TB
item.description: It is one of a number of proposals put forward to deal with the illness in cattle.

item.title: County Monaghan: Young driver dies in two-car crash
item.description: He was driving one of two cars that crashed on the N2 near Clontibret late on Friday night.

item.title: In pictures: People enjoy Northern Ireland's hottest day of the year
item.description: Thermometers hit 27.6C in Killowen, County Down, on Friday - the highest temperature in NI since 2018.

item.title: Colum Eastwood: MP reveals death threats after naming Soldier F
item.description: Colum Eastwood named the former paratrooper, accused of two Bloody Sunday murders, in Parliament.

item.title: NI Troubles: 'Robust conversation' as parties meet Lewis over legacy
item.description: The UK proposals have been widely rejected by the executive parties, Irish government and victims.

item.title: Brexit: UK urged to match 'generosity of spirit' over protocol
item.description: European Commission president Ursula von der Leyen says the protocol is "the only solution".

item.title: Bangor: Man appears in court charged with murder
item.description: Daniel Szcezyelak, 35, is accused of murdering a man in his home on Wednesday.

item.title: Interim Covid vaccine certificates to be launched for NI travellers
item.description: Anyone travelling from Northern Ireland after the 25 July should wait to use a new app.

item.title: NI records 1,380 new Covid-19 cases but no deaths
item.description: There have been 1,380 cases of Covid-19, but no further deaths recorded in the past 24 hours.

item.title: Coronavirus: Hospitality Ulster calls for NI recovery strategy
item.description: Industry representatives say businesses are struggling after lockdown and need help from Stormont.

item.title: Coronavirus: Robin Swann concerned by rise in Covid-19 cases
item.description: More than 1,000 new cases of Covid-19 were recorded in Northern Ireland on Thursday.

item.title: Covid-19: NI eases travel rules from amber list countries
item.description: Fully vaccinated passengers from amber countries will no longer have to self-isolate from 19 July.

item.title: James Norton: Why making Nowhere Special made me sob and want children
item.description: The Grantchester actor on the emotional toll of playing a dying father and why he doesn't mind fame.

item.title: Latest Northern Ireland weather forecast
item.description: The weather forecast in Northern Ireland.

item.title: NI Troubles: Reaction to government plans to deal with the past
item.description: People who lost loved ones during the Troubles have criticised government plans to deal with the past.

item.title: Covid-19: 'I've waited two years to meet my baby daughter'
item.description: Vance McElhinney's partner and baby daughter flew from Vietnam to NI to reunite after the pandemic.

item.title: Songwriter Iain Archer tells MPs streaming model is unethical
item.description: Iain Archer tells MPs composers and artists make very little money from streamed music.

item.title: Child meets police officer who donated kidney to him
item.description: Nine-year-old Joshua and police officer Graham Dodds recall a life-changing kidney transplant.

item.title: Covid-19: Vance McElhinney meets daughter for first time
item.description: Vance McElhinney's partner and baby daughter flew from Vietnam to NI to reunite after the pandemic.

item.title: Paul Givan: 'This is a further insult to victims'
item.description: The government intends to bring forward legislation to ban all Troubles-related prosecutions.

item.title: Michelle O'Neill: 'This does nothing for victims and survivors'
item.description: The government intends to bring forward legislation to ban all Troubles-related prosecutions.

item.title: Final submissions in Lu Na McKinney case
item.description: Stephen McKinney, 44, denies murdering his wife during a boat trip in County Fermanagh, in 2017.

item.title: Shamrock Rovers fight back to sink Derry City
item.description: Derry City manager Ruaidhri Higgins calls on his players to rise to the challenge of beating League of Ireland holders Shamrock Rovers on Friday.

item.title: Man in court charged with murdering partner
item.description: Thomas Davidson, 53, is accused of murdering his partner Kathleen Brankin near Limavady.

item.title: Bloody Sunday: Commons speaker says Eastwood 'broke no rules'
item.description: The SDLP leader used parliamentary privilege to reveal the identity of Soldier F.

item.title: Covid-19: Irish senate passes indoor hospitality legislation
item.description: Fully vaccinated people and those who have recovered from Covid-19 will be able to eat and drink indoors.

item.title: Champions League: Istanbul to host 2023 Champions League final after 2021 switch
item.description: Istanbul is to host the 2023 Champions League final while Dublin will stage the following year's Europa League final.

item.title: Covid-19: Irish government passes indoor hospitality legislation
item.description: New legislation will allow people fully vaccinated against Covid-19 to eat and drink in indoor venues.

item.title: Cocaine disguised as charcoal seized by Gardaí at Rotterdam Port
item.description: The drugs, worth up to €35m, were discovered in two shipping containers carrying bags of charcoal.

item.title: Basketball head resigns after Raheem Sterling post
item.description: Basketball Ireland CEO Bernard O'Byrne apologised for his Facebook post about the England footballer.
